channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Not only is there a pothole in the area where the road was 'resurfaced' but the top of the road the road is collapsing completely and there is also flytipping in the hedgerows, 9th January
item.description:
Pothole in resurfaced area...sides of the road collapsing...top of the road is collapsing completely...and there is flytipping in the hedgrows
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Road West, The Reddings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large pothole on Telstar Way, 8th January
item.description:
There is a very large and deep pothole on Telstar Way on approach to the A40 before the roundabout
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Telstar Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian button constantly on, 8th January
item.description:
The traffic lights on the crossroads of two hedges Rd, Cheltenham Rd and Voxwell Ln have the pedestrian button constantly illuminated this evening. The traffic lights are allowing one direction of traffic through before beeping for pedestrian crossing. The pedestrian button then illuminates again and turns green after one side of traffic has passed. I live opposite the traffic lights and I am unable to get to sleep as the beeping is going off every 30 seconds or so.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grangefield Approach, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Pothole between carriageways, 8th January
item.description:
Pothole that is hit when turning right from Telstar Way onto A40 toward Gloucester. Positioning of pothole means when applying right hand steering through the junction, rear of vehicle can ‘jump’
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Telstar Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive mud on cycle path at junction with roundabout, 8th January
item.description:
The area is covered in mud. A car or cycle could skid, particularly if the mud freezes. Also, its hard for people to cross the road cos its covered in mud.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bouncers Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold

item.title: Multiple potholes on road between pin and Pillcroft Road, poorly patch fixed in the past, 8th January
item.description:
There are multiple potholes located between pin and pillcroft road. There have been poor attempts at patch fixing before that only last until there is rain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Insufficient drainage, owing to agricultural runoff in heavy rain and this drain being lowest point before watercourse, 8th January
item.description:
The drain that backs up is outside of 3 Mill Corner, however the main issue is the insufficient drainage from agricultural fields adjacent to Witcombe village hall. For the past few years, when there is heavy rain if any kind, the silt and water runoff fills all drains en route to the aforementioned drain at the lowest point, causing more water flow than the drain can deal with. This has, on a number of occasions put the properties of 3 and 4 Mill Corner at risk of flooding.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Corner, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo bins full and over flowing, 8th January
item.description:
All the dog poo bins in shipton oliffe are full to the point of over flowing. This has happened regularly and not just because of holidays.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shipton, Cotswold

item.title: Numerous large pots holes, Road surface is also breaking up and subsiding into the drainage ditches. The whole lane requires resurfacing as it is subsiding in places and in a dreadful state of repair., 8th January
item.description:
What3words - remote.quail.movies for the worst potholes. Stoppage.printout.keeps for the entrance to the lane that requires resurfacing. It is a really busy No Through Road also used by heavy plant and lorries. The road surface is in such bad condition that there is a high risk of the road becoming impassable with no access to the properties along the lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashchurch Rural, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A deep pothole on the carriageway, 8th January
item.description:
The pothole is on Cleeve Road travelling towards Gotherington from Bishops Cleeve. It is a very deep pothole that has been there for nearly two months which is likely to cause significant damage to all types of road vehicles and their drivers, especially at night as there is no street lighting to help road users see it. I hit this pothole square on this afternoon and I've never experienced an impact like it. I will have to have my suspension and steering inspected to ensure they have not been damaged or misaligned. The co-ordinates for the pothole are - 51.961, -2.054. What three words - ///racks.birds.exhaling

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cleeve Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
